summary: This document is an email chain from October 28, 2019, discussing scheduling confusion for a meeting involving Mark Epstein. The participants include an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York and an attorney representing a client flying in from Florida, with the meeting originally set for October 31, 2019.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Mark Epstein is the subject of a meeting being scheduled between legal parties; he is the brother of Jeffrey Epstein and was flying from Florida for the meeting.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York is involved in scheduling a meeting regarding Mark Epstein, indicating legal proceedings or discussions.

connections.description: The Assistant United States Attorney is scheduling a meeting involving Mark Epstein, suggesting a legal or investigative interest in him.

events.title: Scheduling confusion for Mark Epstein meeting
events.description: Email exchange reveals confusion over a meeting date for Mark Epstein, with participants debating whether it was set for October 28 or October 31, 2019.

events.title: Proposed meeting with Mark Epstein
events.description: A meeting was proposed for October 31, 2019, at 3:00 p.m. involving Mark Epstein and legal representatives, with Mark Epstein flying in from Florida.

keyFacts: Mark Epstein, Jeffrey Epstein's brother, was flying from Florida to attend a meeting with legal authorities in late October 2019.
An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York was involved in scheduling this meeting, indicating ongoing legal interest in Mark Epstein post-Jeffrey Epstein's death.
There was confusion in email correspondence about whether the meeting was scheduled for October 28 or October 31, 2019, with the latter date being confirmed.
The document is an email chain from October 28, 2019, showing communication between legal parties regarding Mark Epstein.
